intro: Aristolochia zenkeri, commonly known as the African birthwort, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, tubular, maroon-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is known for its aromatic, often foul-smelling blossoms. Its stems are woody and can grow up to several meters in length, allowing it to climb trees and other structures. The plant contains various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine.
